description.narrative: The Project development objective will be changed to "benefit cotton farmers and create the conditions for sustainablegrowthofcott o n production in low income areas of Tajikistan through improved policy environment an better access to finance".

condition.narrative: The Recipient shall carry out Part B.1 of the Project through PFIs selected for participation in the Project in accordance withtheProject Operational Manual (POM).
The Recipient shall ensure that overall responsibility for Project implementation and management are entrusted to the PMU. TheRecipient shall maintain the PMU with sufficient resources.
The Recipient, thru the PMU, shall carry out the Project in accordance with the requirements, criteria, organizationalarrangementsand operational procedures set forth in the POM.

comment.narrative: Core sector indicator on number introduced as per Management instruction.
Four demonstration plots have been established for both research and training
New core indicator introduced as per Management instruction. Baseline was not available

title.narrative: Improved access to finance through the establishment of a revolving credit line for post harvest finance for cotton in selected project area

comment.narrative: The establishment of the credit line was introduced at the time of of restructuring of the project in Dec. 2009
The financing scheme is in place and working. The financing scheme has been extended to other non cotton activities. The loanrepayment is 83% as of Nov. 4

title.narrative: 20,000 farmers receiving at least 80% of the world market price for their cotton output

comment.narrative: As indicated in the comparable farm survey data
The current figure is from the mid-term review assessment of April 2011. Another assessment will be carried out at the end of theproject closing next year.

title.narrative: Termination of the policies that support local processing and marketing monopsonies and restrict farmer ability to use their land freely

baseline.value: 70% of farmers reporting free in their choice of financing sources; 65% of farmers report that they are free to choose the ginfortheir cotton crop; 52% of farmers report that the local government does not prescribe what area should be allocated to cotton.

target.value: 90% of farmers reporting free in their choice of financing sources; 80% of farmers report that they are free to choose the ginfortheir cotton crop; 75% of farmers report that the local government does not prescribe what area should be allocated to cotton.

actual.value: 100% of interviewed farmers were free to choose

comment.narrative: This estimate is based on field interviews carried out during the SPN mission. A formal survey has not been done yet. However, itis quite visible that most of the farmers are now free to choose.

title.narrative: Policy Advisor in place, collaborating actively with staff of President#s Office

actual.value: Policy Adviser was in place and completed his assigment.

comment.narrative: Six working groups have been established and are working on agricultural reform. This has helped move the reform agenda.
